column4: Can anyone point me to a good tutorial to share certain folders over the network to other linux computers?
I want it password protected too
With Ubuntu, you should be able to right-click and choose "Share this folder'
: how does the other computer access it?
smb://hostname/sharename
: you can mount it like that?
There is a way to mount smb shares, but gnome will do it for you automatically
: the other boxes might not have gnome installed
Will you be the only other person using these, or will other ppl be?
Setup an SSH server then.
You can access it via gvfs (i.e. nautilus) or through a command-line tool (rsync, scp) or mount it with sshfs.
Well, you can, I think, but ssh is much more secure, and if you are only going to be doing this on Linux machines, it's the best option IMHO
SSH is also a lot more flexible. You can login and run commands via SSH. This would make working with files over the network easier if you know how to use the command line
If you want minimal overhead, an FTP server would be good, too
flan_suse: If there is anyone else on your network (or if, for example, you have a wifi access point, secured or not) you will want to password protect the share.
I would look at setting up an FTP or NFS server then.
If you're already used to doing this with the windows server and just want to use a Linux server instead, then use a samba share.
From what I can find though google, NFS is fastest transfer for large files.
http://www.brighthub.com/computing/linux/articles/10839.aspx
